topics.body:
Hey Whatevs; bit of politics, but do you think the middle east is falling apart?

Call me crazy, but I hope that Iran treaty goes through cause Yemen's now on the verge of civil war as well.  Obviously it wouldn't make everything sunshine and rainbows, but if we can get them to play ball that would at least slow down things from completely falling apart.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55375b1c636872143a770100#post_55375b1c636872143a770100
I support the Iran Deal because even Mossad disagrees with Netanyahu.

But the middle east is really tribal. That's not really a controversial statement, I don't think.
As such while I doubt it will fall apart it has always struck me as being in a fluctuating state of entropy at all times.
Borders are probably going to be rewritten but I doubt the big players will be gone any time soon.

I would like to see the Saudis go but they'll probably be their own undoing.
Because they keep trying to foment people like ISIS with their oil money to destabilize nearby rivals.
This is a huge problem because it is affecting their own people too... And the problem with ISIS and the House of Saud is the House of Saud are not real caliphs and would be killed if an islamic state movement took over.
They can't have this both ways, something is going to break eventually.
topics.author: 4fe16df67f123b13e400003f

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55375dd0636872219be51500#post_55375dd0636872219be51500
If you ask me playing with ISIS is like playing Russian Roulette and passing it back and forth until someone does blow their head off.  On the one hand their progress into Iraq is slowing down, but in other regions militias and terrorist groups are pledging allegiance to them.  Eventually their game of Russian Roulette is going to end with one of them blowing their heads off.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
